awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I: A Method to Expand Personalized Experiential Learning
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this SBIR Phase I project is to improve education and experiential learning.  The proposed tool will support both synchronous and asynchronous learning while providing students with the opportunity to engage independently and connect their learning to internships, job shadows, service projects, and other real-world learning experiences. This project will enhance teacher capacity to guide and assess student learning, increase transparency and objectivity in assessment, and expand the learning ecosystem of schools by empowering students to engage in and validate authentic, real-world learning experience.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will develop a novel competency-based evaluation tool and learner recommendation engine designed to: assess a range of currently needed skills and competencies, aggregate assessment data for the purpose of generating a comprehensive learner record in real time, and generate personalized competency pathways and recommendations for learning and growth. The key intellectual merits of this proposal are the formulas used to aggregate assessment data over time and the algorithms used to generate personalized competency pathways and learner recommendations. The technical challenges are the development and testing of the associated algorithms to guide and evaluate learning in both academic and authentic, real-world contexts. Research conducted during this Phase I project enable testing and refining of the data aggregation formulas utilized by the assessment tool, as well as optimization of the learner recommendation algorithms used for the creation of personalized competency pathways.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Idea51's Smart Coach
A Method to Expand Personalized Experiential Learning SBIR Phase I Project Project Outcomes Report - Award # 2150912

Idea51’s Smart Coach Learner Growth System represents a major advancement in the field of learning technology. The system is designed to support the teaching and learning of 'durable skills'. Durable skills are important interpersonal skills - such as critical thinking, collaboration, and problem solving - that are transferable across contexts and enable greater agility and adaptability. These skills are essential for success in today’s rapidly changing world of work, and there has been a significant shift toward the adoption of durable skills in schools across the country. For schools that have traditionally focused on subject-area standards, implementing durable skill-based teaching has been a challenge, particularly in the area of assessment.

The primary goal of Idea51’s Phase I SBIR project was to research and develop an intuitive tool that assesses durable skills accurately and provides real-time, actionable recommendations, guidance, and feedback to teachers and students. Idea51 used a highly iterative process to develop the Smart Coach, collaborating with teachers, school leaders, and students from six partner schools representing diverse educational settings (public, private, charter, and micro-school). This process allowed the team to refine the Smart Coach and validate that it could seamlessly integrate into everyday teaching. Ultimately, this process validated the urgent need for a Learner Growth System and the effectiveness of the Smart Coach to address that need.

Intellectual Merit

The intellectual merit of Idea51's project focused on demonstrating the feasibility and quality of the Smart Coach to advance the coaching and teaching of durable skills. Over 150 interviews and consistent engagement with its partner schools formed the foundation for testing and refining the early Smart Coach system. This extensive feedback loop confirmed market demand and validated the tools' effectiveness in both academic and real-world educational settings. The project showcased a sound approach to establishing both technical and commercial feasibility by focusing on real-world applicability and scalability, which are crucial for translation of the Smart Coach from concept to everyday classroom use. The development of the Smart Coach involved innovative data engineering, integrating advanced algorithms and user-centered design principles to ensure accurate, real-time assessments of students' capabilities in dozens of durable skills. Additionally the team tested and demonstrated the feasibility of using Generative AI to provide teachers with immediate coaching recommendations tailored to quickly personalize the learning experience for their students.

Broader Impacts

The broader impacts of Idea51's Smart Coach are significant. To begin, the Smart Coach provides a solution to the challenge of coaching and assessing durable skills in K-12 education. This innovative tool benefits students by providing personalized learning pathways and real-time feedback while equipping teachers with a tool to help them seamlessly tailor their teaching to the individual needs of their students. The broader societal impacts of the Smart Coach, however, extend well beyond schools and classrooms, benefiting both K-12 education and society at large. The Smart Coach equips students with essential durable skills that are increasingly in demand in today's workforce. These skills are crucial in preparing students to take on complex, real-world challenges, as well as preparing them to thrive in a rapidly changing workforce. Moreover, the Smart Coach encourages the personalization of learning, bringing greater equity and inclusion to K-12 education. In short, the Smart Coach aligns with broader societal goals such as enhanced economic competitiveness, reduced social inequalities, and the promotion of lifelong learning.

The team behind the Smart Coach consists of seasoned educational leaders and skilled developers. With an extensive background in educational leadership and curriculum design, the PI’s experience is complemented by the diverse expertise of the company’s other team members. This includes the company’s co-founder and seasoned professional in human-computer interaction and former senior interaction designer at Google, and a data scientist who specializes in data modeling and analytics crucial for the Smart Coach’s development. Idea51’s team also includes specialists in UX research and business development, who bring additional expertise of user experience design and strategic outreach to the project.

The team’s access to advanced tools and facilities, supported by a network of highly qualified advisors and partners from entrepreneurial, legal, and educational domains ensured that the project’s execution was both efficient and up to industry standards. These resources, coupled with Idea51’s strategic partnerships underpin the project's commercial foundation and enrich its potential for successful outcomes in educational technology development.

Throughout Phase I, Idea51 successfully laid a solid foundation not only for its proposed Phase II activities but also for a broader transformation in K-12 education. The successful pilot and iteration process highlighted by Phase I not only confirm the technical feasibility and market demand but also strengthen the product's position to attract further funding and interest from non-SBIR sources, promoting sustained innovation and growth within the educational sector.
